column1: New levels of sadistic boredom. [Full Review in Spanish]
column2: But it also lowers that tone of morality or using morals to justify the avenging God by punishing the sins of others, and that's appreciated. [Full Review in Spanish]
column3: ... more filmic depth than it may seem. [Full review in Spanish]
column4: Seven years after Saw: The Final Chapter, the torture series has returned with a fresh title and a stale everything else.
column5: If you are looking for classic Saw, unfortunately this film only partially delivers, with the same being said for its attempt at fresh originality.
column6: Jigsaw stands as a more-of-the-same followup that seems to have emerged directly from a template for the series...
column7: Fits perfectly inside the gear that is the machine of Saw... [Full review in Spanish]
column8: For fans and newcomers alike, Jigsaw is a disappointment: this reboot has the worst story, the worst characters, the worst writing, the worst twists and the worst traps.
column9: ... it is completely unnecessary, a mere copy of something that worked many years ago. [Full review in Spanish]
column10: It is not as wild as its [predecessors]. [Full Review in Spanish]
column11: The resulting Grand Guignol will please fans, although the gore is never as groundbreaking as the drowning in pig entrails and reserve bear traps of old.
column12: For this franchise, a full 13 years after it was born into the world, it could have been a lot worse.
column13: There's no possible mystery. [Full Review in Spanish]
column14: Considering that Lionsgate had seven years to refocus their flagship horror franchise, the whole of "Jigsaw" is puzzlingly undercooked.
column15: Oh, come on, just stop. Stop it.
column16: Jigsaw is not scary, it's just ugly and cruel.
column17: If it gives you morbid pleasure, you will see it. We do not recommend it. [Full review in Spanish]
column18: [Jigsaw] seems like a necessary reaction to the everyday madness of our newsfeeds.
column19: A marginally better entry into the franchise.
column20: Disappointingly, most of the traps feel more like remixes of the past than anything drastically new.
